publications.description: Community-driven collaborative development builds better software in shorter timeframes

publications.title: Special Report: 8 Criteria for Choosing a Lead Scoring/Marketing Automation Vendor
publications.description: If youve decided your team is ready to adopt lead scoring or marketing automation, then the next big decision is choosing a vendor. While there are many great programs to choose from, you must find one that best fits your needs. In part two of our lead scoring Special Report, Emily W. Salus, Sr. Marketing Manager, CollabNet, highlights eight key criteria to consider when evaluating vendors. Along the way, she provides a handy list of questions to ask yourself -- and the vendors -- to lock in to the best match for your organization. Show less

publications.title: Special Report: When to Adopt Lead Scoring, and How to Justify the Investment
publications.description: B2B marketers considering a lead scoring and marketing automation solution typically wrestle with two major issues: How do I know if I need it -- and if I do, how can I attain budget for it? We tapped Emily W. Salus, Sr. Marketing Manager, CollabNet, to answer these questions. She first shared her experience in implementing lead scoring at MarketingSherpas 2009 B2B Marketing Summit. In the first installment of a two-part Special Report, she explains how to know when youre ready to adopt lead scoring and marketing automation, and offers three strategies for justifying the investment. Show less

publications.title: Lead Scoring: 6 Strategies to Partner with Sales to Rank, ID Prospects
publications.description: Salus describes how her team and the sales department worked together to set up a lead-scoring system. Here are six strategies she recommends for establishing a methodology, setting values for activities, and monitoring efforts.

recommendations.recommendation:
I hired Jessica because we needed a great full-time writer. You name the medium and she created compelling content for it: blogs, customer stories, guides, thought leadership reports, video scripts, PR articles, ads, web pages, sales sequences, etc. But I quickly realized her skills extend far beyond writing. In the 3 years we worked together, we scaled the content marketing function as a whole and built a well-oiled machine. 

She single-handedly ran Beekeeper's social media and blog, as well as spearheaded critical projects like SEO and refreshing/optimizing older content on a weekly cadence that gave us a massive boost in conversion rates. She is wildly creative, but also prioritizes optimization/performance and kept her finger on the pulse of our analytics. And as far as soft skills go, she's a collaborative team player with enormous grit. She's not afraid to take an idea with little direction and create/own the whole process. I would hire her again in a second, best decision I ever made as a manager!

Where to even begin! Jessica is what I like to say an absolute - DOER! She is nothing short of amazing. In the 2+ years I had the privilege of working with Jessica at Beekeeper she was always thinking outside the box and challenging us to do more and more exciting and new things! Beekeeper would truly not be where it is today without her selfless dedication to her craft and her impeccable ability to develop and create content that is not only engaging but enriching to the targeted audience. I would recommend Jessica for anywhere she wants to go next as this is a hire you would not want to miss out on!

Excited for this one at MOpza 

Every company has a different GTM puzzle. Different stage, different vertical, different strategy. Thats why

Even with flawless data, AI still spits out about 20% nonsense. And its mixed right in with the good stuff.

Thats why ops teams cant just

Whos heading to Camp MOpza at MOps-Apalooza?

Dont miss our very own Ed King leading an AI workshop built for ops pros:
 Build trust, not
AI mandates are everywhere in GTM conversations. But folks in #revenueoperations know that better AI starts with getting our data house in order. My

Ops friends: ever feel like half your job is just uploading lists? 

That used to be Rubrik's MOps team until they put AI to work.

Now

Were giving away a FREE 1-year membership to the RevOps Co-op Rise community (a $756 value).

Because lets be real. RevOps has never been a solo

Vimeo had a problem most ops teams can relate to: their tech stack couldnt keep up with how the business was growing.

Instead of forcing a

SEPTEMBER GIVEAWAY: Free Marketing Ops Pro+ Membership! 

Were giving away a FREE Pro+ membership to the Marketing Ops Community (a $1,200

publications.title: Special Report: 8 Criteria for Choosing a Lead Scoring/Marketing Automation Vendor
publications.description: If youve decided your team is ready to adopt lead scoring or marketing automation, then the next big decision is choosing a vendor. While there are many great programs to choose from, you must find one that best fits your needs. In part two of our lead scoring Special Report, Emily W. Salus, Sr. Marketing Manager, CollabNet, highlights eight key criteria to consider when evaluating vendors. Along the way, she provides a handy list of questions to ask yourself -- and the vendors -- to lock in to the best match for your organization. Show less

publications.title: Special Report: When to Adopt Lead Scoring, and How to Justify the Investment
publications.description: B2B marketers considering a lead scoring and marketing automation solution typically wrestle with two major issues: How do I know if I need it -- and if I do, how can I attain budget for it? We tapped Emily W. Salus, Sr. Marketing Manager, CollabNet, to answer these questions. She first shared her experience in implementing lead scoring at MarketingSherpas 2009 B2B Marketing Summit. In the first installment of a two-part Special Report, she explains how to know when youre ready to adopt lead scoring and marketing automation, and offers three strategies for justifying the investment. Show less

publications.title: Lead Scoring: 6 Strategies to Partner with Sales to Rank, ID Prospects
publications.description: Salus describes how her team and the sales department worked together to set up a lead-scoring system. Here are six strategies she recommends for establishing a methodology, setting values for activities, and monitoring efforts.

recommendations.recommendation:
I hired Jessica because we needed a great full-time writer. You name the medium and she created compelling content for it: blogs, customer stories, guides, thought leadership reports, video scripts, PR articles, ads, web pages, sales sequences, etc. But I quickly realized her skills extend far beyond writing. In the 3 years we worked together, we scaled the content marketing function as a whole and built a well-oiled machine. 

She single-handedly ran Beekeeper's social media and blog, as well as spearheaded critical projects like SEO and refreshing/optimizing older content on a weekly cadence that gave us a massive boost in conversion rates. She is wildly creative, but also prioritizes optimization/performance and kept her finger on the pulse of our analytics. And as far as soft skills go, she's a collaborative team player with enormous grit. She's not afraid to take an idea with little direction and create/own the whole process. I would hire her again in a second, best decision I ever made as a manager!

Where to even begin! Jessica is what I like to say an absolute - DOER! She is nothing short of amazing. In the 2+ years I had the privilege of working with Jessica at Beekeeper she was always thinking outside the box and challenging us to do more and more exciting and new things! Beekeeper would truly not be where it is today without her selfless dedication to her craft and her impeccable ability to develop and create content that is not only engaging but enriching to the targeted audience. I would recommend Jessica for anywhere she wants to go next as this is a hire you would not want to miss out on!

Lead and oversee field sales, inside sales, SDR, pre-sales engineers, technology partnership and channel sales team.  Delivered hyper growth by increasing annual M&E revenue from $5M to $85M over three years.  Accomplished and exceeded sales quotas by providing exceptional services.  Improved time to productivity by 33% through development and execution of new hire ramp strategies.  Increased channel partners by 5x and ISV partners by 10x via executing new channel and technology partner programs.  Led successful US federal team transition from point product specialists into solution sales focus with aim of improving quota performance in 2014 and 2015. Show less
